page.title: 16EASTCOMBE 1
page.content: Eastcombe is a village of some 245 houses. Until about 1960s very little change occurred in its character. Now many new houses are being built on its upper slopes. It as a small church, a Baptist chapel, a primary school and a secondary school which serves a larger area. It has a pub, a shop and a doctors' surgery. The oldest part of the village is on the lowest slope of the hill. The earliest house,"Rodways" was originally a farm dating back to before 1500 as it once had no chimney- only a hole in the roof. In a survey in 1851 the majority of the people were employed in the cloth mills in the Stroud valley, having in earlier times been self-employed weavers working in their own cottages. Then many cottagers kept a pig and had other jobs like having a small shop, mending shoes and selling rice pudding
